Package org.chocosolver.solver.search.loop.move

Class MoveRestart

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chocosolver.solver.search.loop.move.MoveRestart
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Move
    public class MoveRestart
extends Object
implements Move
    This Move implementation enables restarting a search on certain conditions (most of the time based on a counter). It is not self-content and needs a underlying Move to delegate common movements when no restart is needed.

    Created by cprudhom on 03/09/15. Project: choco.

    Since:
    03/09/2015
    Author:
    Charles Prud'homme

                   LongCriterion criterion,
                   int restartLimit)
        Parameters:
        move - the default Move to execute when no restart has to be done
        restartStrategy - defines when restarts happen
        criterion - defines how to trigger a restart
        restartLimit - restrict the total number of restart

      • setTopDecisionPosition

        public void setTopDecisionPosition​(int position)
        Description copied from interface: Move
        Indicates the position of decision made just before selecting this move. When only one "terminal" move is declared, the top decision decision is -1. When dealing with a sequence of Move, the position is the one of the last decision of the previous move. In consequence, when backtracking, the right move can be applied or stopped when needed. This has to be declared on the first call to Move.extend(Solver) and is checked on Move.repair(Solver).
        Specified by:
        setTopDecisionPosition in interface Move
        Parameters:
        position - position of the last decision taken before applying this move
